column4: I've got a question about 12.10 "Quantal", my distro apparently automatically updated to it. Does anyone have any idea how it could have happened? I installed a few -dev packages today, but other than that I have no idea how it happened. Ideas?
Ubuntu will not automatically upgrade to a new version of Ubuntu, certainly not to a development version.
Why do you think you're running Ubuntu 12.10?
the TTYs list 12.10 Quantal when I login.. in the Details section of the System Settings it does still list "12.04" however.
Can you pastebin the output of "lsb_release -a"?
Could you pastebin the contents of /etc/apt/sources.list?
Odd, that looks correct (except for the few third party repos setup for oneiric).
Can you pastebin the outptu of "apt-cache policy base-files"?
I know it seems pretty strange to me considering I hadn't done anything manually
Does "sudo apt-get install --reinstall base-files" change the contents of /etc/issue ?
thanks for your help, at this time I don't think the Quantal problem is a huge issue, nothing seems to be broken!
Please file a bug report anyway, just becuase it shouldn't have happened and may be a symptom of something worse.
